result.execSummary:
The defendant Garrion D Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: 4 day(s) RCJ for contempt for failure to pay.  $200 DNA surcharge assessed.
Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Garrion D Harris

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per RCSO, DNA collected - 02-12-2016 at 10:30 am

Defendant Garrion D Harris in court with attorney Erika Lynn Moore.  Chris Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Plea - G.
BTC: GUILTY.
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
$200+cc+DNA, pp $25/mo beg 4-1-16, ftp 4 days RCJ for contempt.

  ***Expungement to be granted upon successful completion of the sentence.***

The bond ordered by the court on:  1-26-16
has been signed.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: ***1-26-16 MODIFY $100 CASH BOND TO $200 CASH BOND. DEFT HAS UNTIL 4PM 1-28-16 TO POST BOND. FAILURE TO POST, DEFT MUST REPORT TO RCJ.***  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Garrion D Harris in court with attorney Erika Lynn Moore.  Matthew J Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Matter is scheduled on the Court's Motion to review bond.
Deft is non compliant with ZCI.
State is requesting a $100 cash bond.
Def requests that if the Court imposes a cash bond that he be given until Friday 1-29-16 to post.
BTC: Cash bond amended to $200 cash, all other conditions remain, deft has until 4pm 1-28-16, failure to post, report to RCJ.
from Zimmerman Consulting Inc. - defendant is in violation of agency requirements.

Defendant Garrion D Harris in court with attorney Erika Lynn Moore.  Matthew J Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
State has extended an offer.
Def is requesting an adjournment to have a chance to obtain the discovery.
BTC: Matter adjourned, Deft to go to ZCI after court.
  Status conference scheduled for February 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Pre-trial conference at 11-19-2015 03:15 pm.
Status conference at 12-21-2015 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Garrion D Harris in court.  Lillian V. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
